elements.name: overallRating
question4
elements.html:
For a similar case tomorrow:


I would need to talk them through - Required constant direction during discussion

I would need to prompt - Demonstrates some independence, but would require intermittent direction on appropriate course of action during the discussion

I would need to be there just in case - Mostly independent, but still requires supervision for safe practice

I wouldn't need to be there - Understands risks and demonstrated a safe approach to patient care, appears ready for independent practice

elements.title: OVERALL RATING
elements.description: Supervisor/ Trainer observes the trainee during the patient consultation and indicates which describes the competence of the trainee in the scenario observed

elements.name: question3
elements.html: Supervisor/Trainer uses the prompts below to provide comments on the traineeâ€™s performance in at least 3 areas.

elements.name: assessment
elements.title: Assessment
elements.description: Presented findings from history and examination succinctly; developed appropriate differential diagnosis; interpreted investigations accurately.

elements.name: managementPlan
elements.title: Management Plan
elements.description: Formulated an appropriate management plan from information gathered during assessment; incorporated specific needs of patient; engaged multidisciplinary input as appropriate; provided rationale for decision making, incorporating relevant evidence.

elements.name: provisionOfCare
elements.title: Provision of Care
elements.description: Implemented management plan safely, adjusted plan to new information, if required; liaised with multidisciplinary team as planned; managed any complications appropriately.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Alternate Scenarios
elements.description: Responded appropriately to posed scenarios in relation to different patient or surgical factors (including demonstrating cultural competency and safety), unexpected events in theatre and/or emergency management. Identified limits of expertise and recognised when to seek help from colleagues

elements.name: writtenCommunication
elements.title: Written Communication and Record Keeping
elements.description: Prepared suitable letters to referring practitioners and other health professional as required; language appropriate to audience; contemporaneous record keeping, noting relevant details to aid continuity of care.

elements.name: generalComments
elements.title: General Comments on what was done well or what could be improved

choices.text: Trainee should repeat this activity on a similar case
